(Noàłe o Noàl in Veneto dialect) is a quiet countryside town located between

. 
The churches, buildings and palaces of the town centre testifies Noale’s important past, both during the Middle-Ages than under the Republic of Venice. The walls, the defensive system, the Medieval Fortress and Castle all remind of a time of lords, duels and parades… a time which is revised every here during the famous Noale Palio.
A relaxing stay in Noale will also give you the opportunities to taste the culinary specialties of the Venice area, with its very interesting combination of seafood and meat. A visit to the local restaurants and trattorias is also an opportunity to taste one of the several dishes which are prepared with the main protagonist of Noale’s cuisine, the duck.
Finally, why not shop at the medieval markets or search for something unique at the Trovarobe flea market on Sunday?

Noale railway station has direct train connections with Venice, Padua and Treviso:
Venice is 40min ride away
Padua is 1h ride away
Treviso is 1h ride away
More info is available on Trenitalia’s website (

Noale is just 35km north-west of Venice, 28km north-east of Padua and 23Km south-east of Treviso. Noale can easily be reached through the A4 Milano-Trieste highway (Martellago/Scorzé exit).
